content:
Posted: November 1, 2014
												When I got this for Christmas in 1999 along with Half-Life, I didn't even know what it was. When I got home two days later and installed it, my family wouldnt have access to our computer again. I used to trade off every 5 deaths or 20 kills with my little brother until the late hours of the night. When I would get in trouble, TFC would be taken away, and I would have to go outside and play. I can still remember my best friends names, though I doubt they still play it. I can even still remember my favorite medic. I remember mulching until I could finally kick the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of anyone (this was before stat tracking, though I would assume the hours would be in the thousands.) VIP, Climb, and Jump maps were perfect to kill time and be silly with all your friends. Though I havent played since TF2 came out, I miss this game more than anything ever. Definitely the fondest memory I have as a child. This game made me fall in love with Sierra (VALVE), and to know what real FPS's should be like. I have purchased this game three times after the initial gift, to install on friends and girlfriends computers so that I could play at their houses. Buy this even if it's just to have it in your collection and you never play it. At least you can say that you have it and pretend that you are OG. I love you TFC.

number of helpful: 161 of 192 people (84%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 26, 2014
												Team Fortress Classic is not at all what I was expecting when I launched it for the first time. I went in assuming I was going to be playing an old school downgrade of Team Fortress 2. I was wrong, TFC is in its own rights a completely different game at first glance. The story, the graphics, and even the controls feel different, but if you play it long enough you will come to find that the game is Team Fortress at its core. The game itself has all the Team Fortress 2 "DNA" in there you just dont quite see it at first. If you play a while you will not only feel the Team Fortress-ness in the game (its the original Team Fortress so obviously) But you will get to see where the masterpiece that is Team Fortress 2 comes from, you get to see its "roots" so to speak. That in and of itself should be reason enough to play, but If I have not convinced you yet here is another reason, the best reason to play as a matter of fact. Team Fortress Classic is fun!

content:
Posted: July 20, 2015
												Team Fortress Classic has nothing to do with Team Fortress 2. They are completely different games with different mechanics, although the classes seem similar.General:-TFC has grenades.-Classes also have armor.-Health Pool is different.-Bhop is possible.-While in TF2, the best gamemodes are Control Points, King of the Hill and Payload, in TFC it is actually Capture the Flag.Scout:-In TFC, he is used for his speed to cap the flag, rarely fights.-No double jump. Concussion grenades are used and they are way more powerful.-No Scattergun, has only a weak shotgun and a Nailgun used against sentries.Soldier:-Soldier has normal grenades and nail grenades - which shoot nails in 360 degrees and deal damage.-Has a normal weak shotgun and a more powerful one.Pyro:-No airblast.-Flamethrower deals damage depending on the amount of armor the victim has.-Has an Incendiary Cannon which acts as a Rocket Launcher, but sets enemies on fire.-Has normal grenades and Napalm grenades - which set enemies on fire.Demoman:-No Stickybomb Launcher, replaced by the Pipebomb Launcher. Pipebombs don't stick to surface.-The Grenade and Pipebomb Launcher share the same ammo pool.-Has a single-barrel shotgun.-Has a detpack which has the ability to clear obstacles and open new entrances.-Has normal grenades and MIRV ones - they split into smaller grenades which explode.Heavy:-Has 2 shotguns.-Also has MIRV grenades.Engineer:-Cannot pick-up buildings.-Has powerful EMP grenades which blow up the enemy's ammo and cause damage.Medic:-Medic is also used for capping flags because of his speed and concussion jumping ability, but is more powerful than Scout.-Can infect classes with his medpack.-No Medigun therefore no Ubercharge.-His super nailgun is good against sentry guns.Sniper:-Basically TF2 sniper with the Classic and grenades.Spy:-Has a Tranquilizer Gun.-Has a shotgun.-Can feign death. -Has Hallucination Grenades.Civillian is the last class which is used in special gamemodes.Teams are pit against each other where Red uses defensive classes to protect their flag from Blue, which use mainly Scouts and Medics to capture it.The community is very small and there are only a couple of servers at a time, but the game is a classic and I recommend it.

number of helpful: 118 of 127 people (93%) found this review helpful17 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 11, 2015
												A great underrated classic that still has populated servers 24/7. (You can check for players with the in-game server list, bots won't be shown.) TFC offers one-of-a-kind exciting fast paced gameplay with tons of tactics and ways of playing the game. Easy to get into and enjoy, hard to master. However, you're bound to have fun along the way.Despite old age, the game has a timeless design with a completely customizable appearance; you can choose from many custom models, sprites, skins, textures etc. There are active community servers hosting many of thousands of custom maps total with official game modes like; Capture The Flag, Control point, Attack/Defend, Escort, Deathmatch as well as custom ones like King of the Hill, Hold or Score Ball etc.If you're interested in skill jumping (with weapons) there are servers hosting maps made for conc-, grenade-, rocket- and pipe jumping. There are also a lot of movement skill maps where you can climb, bunnyhop, strafe, surf, ramp slide and even water glide (shark) on a few servers. Or if you just want to play some random fun maps and mess around, there's escape, puzzle, hide & seek, sniping, role-play, secret hunting, low gravity and so on. As for mods, there's NeoTF (which gives you extra abilities and buildables), AdminOP (Ent Mod, Radio Mod, Hook Mod) and others.It's not just one of, but The most popular online multiplayer game of all back in 1999 before CS took the crown. Nowadays, there are barely any FPS games that don't get boring after a few hours. TFC will have you keep coming back for more, time and time again. Without relying on achievements or item drops.

Posted: November 12, 2014
												13 Years later still the ONLY FPS game on PC that I can actually play for more than 5 mins at a time.  In fact I can play for days at a time.  The speed, control, strategy and overal logic this game uses is pure beauty.  Although it blatantly breaks nearly every realistic law of physics known to man kind, it still easily trumps all of the zombie filled, fantasy land, role-playing nonsense this next generation has grown to obsess over.  It makes no sense how fun and enjoyable this game STILL is, regardless of it being ''dead'' and bereft of nearly all organized play (outside off all of the low-lifes wasting everyones time using Perfect Player packages in the pickups ofc).  You may need to be born before 1990 or so to truly grasp the awesomeness of this game, but if you do, kudos and thank you for playing.  Nuff said.rufi0

content:
Posted: November 26, 2013
												It's painful for me to not recommend this game because TFC is without question one of my favorite games of all time. I've played the game for thousands of hours and in hundreds of clan matches of all skill levels, but today there's virtually no servers left, and of those that are remaining, most are filled with lousy bots most the time.If you are lucky enough to find real players, the majority of them playing today are experienced, and trust me- if you're brand new to the game, they'll absolutely crush you. I don't care how good you think you are at other FPS games, they'll run circles around you :) There's just a lot of skills to learn in TFC, and it takes most people years to become a decent player.5-10 years ago I would recommend this game hands down. It is in my opinion one of the greatest multiplayer FPS games of all time. Sadly it's just too dead now for me to recommend.Edit: Some people keep mentioning that it says I only have 6 hours in the game. I can assure you that I have thousands of hours, some before Steam started keeping track, and even more before Steam even existed. This was back when you connected through WON to play the game. Trust me, I know TFC. :)

content:
Posted: February 17, 2016
												Let me be honest right up front. This is for new and potentially new players. Vets of the game already know why TFC is still for sale, and not F2P like it's "decendent". TFC is a game I've been playing for over 15 years. It is, without a doubt, the most FUN game in my library. You have the same 9 classes as TF2, however, with many differences. The Spy can't turn invisible, but can "feign death". Be careful with this ability, as it's not impossible to spot a Spy trying to pull their tricks.Grenades! TFC has grenades, and lots of them! Every class(except Sniper) has a class specific secondary grenade. All classes(except Scout) have your normal issue "Frag" grenade. Using these grenades can help you either kill an enemy, or assist your movements. When you first begin playing, you WILL get your butt handed to you. A lot. This is normal, and all TFC players have been through it. Don't let that deter you. The game engine has lots of nuances for you to learn, but it takes time. Really, it takes lots of time to learn, but many players are willing to teach you. All you have to do is ask. You may encounter players who have forgotten what it's like to be new to the game. Ignore them, or mute them. I may not be the best TFC player around, but I'm a team player, and I don't mind teaching what I know. Feel free to friend me, and just ask.Don't expect "Hats". TFC is a game where tactics and skill are utilized, we don't need no stinking Hats. ;)Edit: One more thing I'd like to add...While I'm not the best player ever at the game, I do know lots of tricks, and skills. If anyone would like me to teach  you some of what I know, feel free to add me as a friend on Steam, and just ask. New players will keep this game alive for another 17 years, and if I can help you along to enjoy the game more, I'm quite happy to help.

content:
Posted: July 18, 2014
												You must try this game, who knows, maybe you will like it.The game mechanics are somewhat different from the ones used by TF2, and I could explain most of them:And yes, I will try to compare this game's features with TF2's, assuming that most players are now coming from it.Control point mapsIn control point maps, instead of staying on a capture point until it gets claimed, you have to bring a flag on it. While this doesn't support much the teamwork strategy because everyone is like "The flag is now mine, I am going to cap",  some people play the right way and let the scout do the job while they offer covering fire.However, some maps like Dustbowl on the first stage are messed up, the RED team camping near the grenade backpack and spamming all the way until the round ends.Capture the flagSame as you can see in TF2, that's how CTF acted in all team fortress stages, excepting that, unlike TF2, the place where you have to bring the flag is different from the place the enemy can find your flag, making this a bit confusing for new players.Even in this moment I bring the enemy flag to my team's flag in 2fort.EscortA great gamemode, that in TF2 got brutally converted into payload. (there where alot of reasons I will explain later)In this gamemode you will have to escort (AKA help a a guy reach a place alive) a class called "Civillian" (yes, TFC  has 10 classes).The civillian features low stats, having only 50 health points, no armor, grenades or weapons other than an umbrella, which is a crowbar reskin.There are 3 teams:The escort- only the civillian available. Only 1 can play as the civilian in a game.The bodyguards - the people who must escort the civillian to the destination. Only soldier, heavy and medics available.The assasins - must prevent the civillian to reach the destination. Only playable as snipers.In TF2, the escort mode was scrapped for multiple reasons, such as the fact it had too many limits.You had class limits, being forced to play as medic, heavy and soldier as bodyguards and as sniper on the assasins.Also, certain civillians were trolls, refusing to get out from the spawn or jumping in front of the enemy.No more saying there could only be 1 civillian, releasing many flamewars between players.Then Valve made a similar gamemode, where you have to 'escort' a bomb cart by staying near it so you can 'push' it, while the other team prevents you for doing that.ClassesThe scout:Unlike in TF2, the scout was NOT made for agressive combat, not even for combat itself. It has a 'syringegun' called nailgun and a single-barrel shotgun.Players use the scout's speed and the conc-jump technique to quickly complete the objectives.Unfortunatelly, the scout has low health, being able to be killed by a single rocket, and lacks double jumping.The soldier:The soldier from TF2 seems to not have changed much.The only differences between them is that the TFC soldier has 2 types of shotguns equipped at once and also has hand grenades.The pyro:Oh pyro... poor pyro, the class valve forgot to buff.You basically have a flamethrower that shoots rapid-fire 'bubbles' of fire, that will never hit someone.Also, the afterburn is only like 2 seconds and deals like 4 damage/tick.The pyro also has a rocket launcher that does not need to be realoaded, but deals no damage at all and ignites the enemies that stay in range, but again, the aferburn is weak.You also have a single barrel shotgun...The demoman:A class you will rarely see played, same as in TF2.People don't know the air detonation technique, which is deadly in TFC.As the demoman, you have a grenade launcher with a clip of 6 and a sticky launcher with also a clip of 6. They use the same ammo and clip, tough.The demoamn also has a single-barrel shotgun, and the unique abbility to set a bomb that is able to open new routes on a map by removing certain walls.Heavy weapons guy:The heavy is more decent to play that in TF2, you have a plenty of health and armor, and a powerful MIRV granade that creates explosions similar to the Sentry buster from TF2.You also have 2 shotguns types: The one-barrel and 2-barrel.You cannot deploy your minigun without firing, so you will stay more in combat rather than camping near corners, like people do in TF2.Engineer:The engineer is quite weak compared to the TF2 one. I mean, you have a double barrel shotgun, which is very good, and a railgun, which is the worst weapon in the game due to the slow projectile and low damage.The sentry upgrades instantly if you have enough 'metal' (called 'cells' in TFC) and is the only upgradable building.The sentrygun cannot rotate, the engineer being forced to place the sentrygun in corners, or to rotate it manually.The dispenser is not upgradable and does NOT generate ammo, health and metal, as it does in TF2, so the engineer has to fill it manually.Also, the enemy can use your dispenser.You will rarely see an engineer building a dispenser, unless they are really bored, because it does not heal, does not provide ammo unless filled with, and does not give metal, so players preffer to collect backpacks filled with goods at every corner.The only good thing about dispensers is that they can repair armor (if filled).The teleporter is not upgradable, but efficient.The lack of hauling buildings and the addition of grenades in TFC makes it hard to be an engineer, trust me.Medic:The medic is actually an upgraded version of the scout, but not worth playing.The lack of 'assist' in the kill feed and the fact that you don't get points for healing, will end up with you having 0 points even if you were an efficient medic that deserved #1 in TF2.What do I mean by upgraded scout?Remind scout's weapons? Nailgun and single barrel shotgun, also a crowbar.Medic's loadout? SUPER Nailgun, DOUBLE barrel shotgun and the medkit (as melee).The medkit is the most overpowered weapon.Why? once hitting an enemy with it, it will become infected, causing his health to drain constantly until dies or healed by a medic. Also, the infection can be spread trough teammates... darn it valve.Also, the medic is designed more for combat, and healing teammates that are hiding, because you cannot heal while you or your teammate move.The sniper:Remember the sniper rifle in TF2 called "the Classic"?Use it to see how being a sniper is like in TFC.The spy:The spy, a kinda broken class, has a tranquilizer gun that slows down enemies, a double barrel shotgun and a knife.The stupid thing about the spy is that the disguise takes about 5 bloody seconds (while just like 2 in TF2) and you have no cloak feature.However, the lack of spychecking weapons other than the medic's medkit, may do the job.You can feign death, but you have to stay down, as a random dead body, and if you move, you actually spin like a drunk hobo and suspicious players will shoot.The backstab seems to be broken most of the time, resuting in failed facestabs.Additionally, if an enemy scout or spy runs into you, your disguise is removed.Only things I don't like on this game (along with the broken classes) are these:-Lack of resupply cabinets: If someone spawn camps you and you are hurt badly (or infected) you are forced to die.-Solid hitboxes: You cannot get past teammates as in TF2 and you cannot do the bump-spycheck.-All classes use the same voice, the only lines you will hear being "Medic!" and "Excuse me, I'm in need of medical attention." thus making it hard to see which class is approaching.On short, totally worth playing, and if you are bored you can try the FUN servers (which are better than the TF2 ones because the civillian class is used alot in them), and if you totally suck like me, you can enjoy playing singleplayer with bots.+8/10

content:
Posted: December 28, 2014
												This is an amazing game. You just have to know that if you treat it like Team Fortress 2, you're gonna have a bad time! This game is significantly different than Team Fortress 2. It has a more competitive, fast-paced feeling where people try to work together to complete the objective. If you're used to Team Fortress 2, you have to know some differences before you get in game, get your♥♥♥♥♥wooped then go to write a negative review about this. Scouts are not designed for combat and are just for completing the objective. Getting a single kill as a scout is hard to do.  I personally like this scout concept over the Team Fortress 2 one. The people that still want a fast combat class in the game, don't worry! There's still a class for that. Recently, Team Fortress 2 got a new rifle called the 'Classic'. If you know how that works, you can grasp the concept of the classic sniper pretty well. Although, the TFC sniper does not suck as much as the classic. Soldier is the same except he has two shotguns. On the topic of shotguns, there are two of them. A double-barreled one that does more damage yet a slower fire rate and a slower reload and a single-barreled one that does more damage yet a faster fire rate and a faster reload. Shotguns in this game have no fall-off.Demoman is pretty similar. Your pipebomb launcher is your stickybomb launcher as Team Fortress 2 players are used to. Except the pipeboms do not stick. You have a single-barreled shotgun and you can place an instakill detpack that explodes in 5, 20, 50 seconds. The detpack can also be used to open entrances. Medic is the most changed class. Medic is for combat, healing, and capturing objectives. Your medkit can infect enemies and you have two shotguns. You also have a conc grenade that you can use to conc jump which we'll go over later. HWGuy has the same difference as soldier. You still have a minigun, but you have two shotguns.Pyro is weaker than his Team Fortress 2 counterpart. Your main job is to confuse and it is not to wreck. You have an incendiary RPG and you cannot airblast. Spy is the second most different when compared to his Team Fortress 2 counterpart. You have a double-barreled shotgun, a pistol that slows enemies down, and a nailgun. You can disguise still and you can do a crappy feign death that makes you turn into a corpse. No one falls for it and it doesn't even show up in the killfeed. It's good for hiding yet it sucks for tricking. YES BACKSTABS STILL EXIST. Engineer is pretty similar. You cannot upgrade dispensers and teleporters, but you can upgrade sentry guns. Sentry guns can be upgraded in 1 hit as long as you have 130 cells (metal). You also have a weak railgun that's more for finishing off rather than taking on a full health target. Dispensers only give armor and ammo, but no health.General Differences: There are grenades. Grenades. Every Team Fortress Classic class has a frag grenade (except scout), and a special grenade. Scout has two special grenades.Movement is a lot more intricate. You can jump with grenades and bunnyhop. There are more gamemodes and maps.On flag capturing maps, you don't take the flag back to your flag and you take it to somewhere else.There is armor.

Posted: June 8, 2016
Product received for free
												I played Team Fortress Classic for the first time in 2013, it wasnt my game, it was awful for me, couldn't stand a chance agaisnt scouts, I was really really bad at the game. But now,after 8 months of not playing it, I understand that this is a huge game with lots of things to do, and guess what? You need skill. How much skill? Lots, lots of skill, the first class I played as was as the Scout, it was fun to mess around and die in 1 hit by a direct rocket hit, hehe, but then I got serious in the game, started playing it like a competitive game, and then, I got good at it, I played lots of matches, some were versus bots and some with veterans, then, I started playing with the most ''useless'' classes that people think that are really bad and that people should never play with them, played as demoman, got a 4 kill streak once, played as pyro, killed the entire opposing team in a match, and they say that the game is dead, bad, unbalanced, not fun, not worth buying, those people are wrong, very very wrong, this game is worth all of your time and your money. Buy it, you will not regret this massively fast paced first person shooter. Player name: Johneehboi, you can find me playing on medium populated servers such as Twisted Dustbowl and some others. Many thanks to the Steam user ''Tom Fortress Classic'' for giving me this game as a gift, thank you very much.

content:
Posted: January 30
												I remember when I was younger this was the one game that my dad would always play. He was always a Sniper or a Soldier. The servers he played on mostly consisted of his friends.Fast forward a decade later. I finally get this game along with the Valve Complete Pack for Christmas. I go in, and well, not surprised to see how many servers are open and the most I can ever find is 10 people in just one. But ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, the nostalgia. That booming voice, the triumphant music, the grenades... All sounds just spamming together into one huge orgy that even porn websites can't compete with.The game is really fun, has mechanics so different from Team Fortress 2, that it will be confusing for those who only play its sequel. Grenades are so fun to mess around with until you throw one at yourself. I suggest actually finding a server to practice with each class and all features that each class has, and obviously, must read what the default key binds are. You don't want to be spending 4 minutes trying to find the grenade button or the Medic button.I recommend new players or curious TF2 players to try this. But don't think just because you're good at other shooting games or good at TF2, that you're gonna do well in this. Oh, and also:YOUR TEAM CAPTURED. THE FLAG.

content:
Posted: December 23, 2016
												This game can be very challenging and frustrating at first, and is almost an entirely different game than Team Fortress 2. If you are an experienced TF2 player, do not expect to be able to walk right into this easily. This game was released in 1999, and there are people that started playing that year, and still play to this day. This is one of the main reasons this game is so difficult. However, I personally enjoy a challenge, and like TFC better than TF2. It just has the classic game design that I love. It also has a wider variety of practical strategies and more maps. Unfortunately though, it has a relatively small community and few servers. If you are questioning whether you'll buy this game or not, I highly recommend waiting until a Steam sale to do so.

number of helpful: 24 of 27 people (89%) found this review helpful5 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 9, 2016
												Team Fortress Classic is a precursor to TF2 a highly popular Hat Simulator made by valve, so let's take a step back and look at the first game in the series. Team Fortress Classic is similar to all early valve multiplayer games and by that I mean, Counter Strike and Half Life Deathmatch. The gameplay is similar, but there is a different gameplay spin in each game. For example in Counter Strike you use real life weapons, in Half Life you use iconic weaponry from the games and in Team Fortress you have classes.Classes range from a heavy who uses a mini gun, to a spy and a medic and many many more. All of them have different weaponry and all function differently on the field. Some weapons do more damage, but fire slower or vice versa. It all boils down to skill and it's really fun.Gameplay wise, I only got the chance to try out Capture the Flag as it's the only server I found which still contains a nice amount of dedicated players which is nice. Other gamemodes have a few players, but the game is pretty much dead and I will get into that a bit later.Graphically this is a mod of the Half Life game similar to Counter Strike, so a lot of the same assets and models are in this game. It's not aged well, but overall graphics are not the selling point for this game.Gameplay is really fun, it's challenging and rewarding and it's general a really good gameplay design.Now the only bad thing is a major problem with the game. It has a dying community and it's dying rapidly. I only found one server that had 13 people in total, while others only had 2 or no players. It's a dying game, but the people that play it, they are very dedicated players so you can get in touch with a community and get  a game going.Overall Team Fortress Classic is a fun game, is it as good as Team Fortress 2 ? No, not really. While I like the gameplay more in this game, I still think Team Fortress 2 is the better game.Final Rating:6/10 Pros:+ In Depth GameplayCons:-Dying Community

												Great game, it's 1990's fps in it's purest form. If you can look past the dated graphics, then you are in for a great time. - The community may be pretty small, but they are still humble and not totaly toxic. (Looking at you Fortress Forever)- The classes are all well balanced. Except combat Medic and Scout who can go totaly ham when in the right hands.- There are only a handful of constantly populated servers left, but when you find them it's really fun.- Very high skill ceiling. It's the defenition of easy to learn, hard as balls to master. So if you want a rewarding and chalenging fps, then this is up your alley.- Pretty dated graphics, but again, try your best to look past them.- When the game is on sale it is dirt cheap. I picked it up for 1 dollar, worth every penny.8/10 - Good game.

content:
Posted: July 15, 2016
												Team Fortress Classic is class-based multiplayer FPS developed as a mod for the original Half-Life. There are ten classes to choose from, each of them with varying strengths, weaknesses and abilities, Although one of them is literally useless and only appears in one game mode as a target. There is a heavy emphasis on teamwork between players of different classes requiring a well-balanced offence and defence. The game modes can revolve around capturing the flag, territory captures, or protecting a VIP. Typically, players have the choice of two teams (Red and Blue) with a maximum of 32 players in a server .Team Fortress Classic is much like Team Fortress 2 , and it still has hundreds of servers running so you won't find it difficult to find yourself servers to play.8/10 From MeSweep

content:
Posted: March 19
												This is a historically important game as far as multiplayer FPSes are concerned, but is it worth playing now? Well...if it's on sale and/or if you adore vintage shooters, I'd say yes.Comparing this to Team Fortress 2 is kind of like looking into a time capsule. It's janky, not that well-balanced, and the grenade spam is real (real stupid, even.) The Spy has no cloak or sapper, instead he can feign death as a fake corpse, and if anything that makes him even harder to play. The Pyro is kind of useless, and the Medic usually ends up launching himself at the enemy team to poison them with his medkit, which let me tell you is far, far less intuitive than TF2's mediguns.Both he and the Scout have concussion grenades that let experienced players literally fly all over the map, in addition to bunnyhopping letting you go faster in general, although at least the game doesn't totally revolve around them like Fortress Forever does.On the other hand, there's not hundreds and hundreds of hats bloating the game, and since there's no unlockable weapons & less hidden "pro level" mechanics to learn about, it's actually a little more intuitive overall than TF2 is at this point.It can still be fun - it still has that Team Fortress magic, but with the high percentage of veterans in the playerbase and the age of the game, you'll have to come to terms with it like most old school titles. There's not that many players; the daily average is around 100. Some of them will clean your clock if you're new, as mentioned before. If you want to experience this, ideally you'd get a couple friends to join you, or find a 'TFC revival' group that arranges pick-up games.

												PROS:- Somewhat solid gameplay- Good weapon balance- Classic, well-known, and kickass maps- Set the basis for the game we know and love todayCONS:- Controls feel stiff at times- at it's worst, unresponsive.- The community is lacking, as to be expected from a game that is 17 years old.- Can get very drab and slow at times (in my opinion)OVERALL:This game is a ♥♥♥♥ing classic, and really provides an interesting look at the game that molded the amazing game we know today. While still primitive as far as it's graphics and mechanics, TFC can still definetly provide a fun and fullfilling experience. It has a rather significant lack in servers, but when there is a populated server, the battle can get intense and fun. I recommend this game for both people looking for a classic goldie to toy around with, and for people who are curious to see the father of TF2 by themselves.

content:
Posted: June 28, 2016
												As a TF2 player, I can tell you that TFC is far from it, but at the same time as close to Tf2 as twins. Something that makes it different is that it definitely requires a lot of skill, I mean a lot. You also need to remember to pick up on what you need to do and what exactly is going on. Unlike TF2, the information isn't always right up in your face. You almost always have to have a strategy otherwise you'll be dead really quickly. Oh yeah, and grenades.There are a lot of elements of this game that tells you that this is, without a doubt, the father of TF2. Something most notable and most obvious is how fast paced they both are. Seriously, first 2 minutes of any game from both of these titles has more action then a James Bond movie on steroids most the time. Another thing I'd like to point out is that over the years, the classes still have almost the exact same elements and still have the same purpose (With probably the exception of pyro, but that's debatable.) It's suprising to see that even after all that's been added to TF2 and how much you may think that it's not close to it's orgin, but really, Everything you had from the first is pretty much right there (Other than 'nades XD).I seriously recomend this game and I aplaud the community that supports it. Even though it's old, it's probably one of the best games you could find on steam. It deserves a lot more attention. And in my opinion, It's certainly worth $4.99.

content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
Its a classic. The Team Fortress classic.As seen in the catchup in Team Fortress 2, it takes place in 1933 in a Black Mesa like environment. If I should have to place it in a timeline, TFC takes place in Black Mesa before the incident happened. Summary:There are two teams: RED and BLUE with each team consisting of 9 (sometimes 10) classes:Classes- Scout- Soldier- Pyro- Demolution Man- Heavy Weapons Guy- Engineer- Combat Medic- Sniper- Spy- CivillianThere are also plenty of different Gamemodes (based on CTF):Gamemodes - Capture the Flag - Reverse Capture the Flag - Attack Defend Capture the Flag - Territorial Control Capture the Flag - Football Capture the FlagSadly, not many players are playing TFC at all.. there are just like two servers permanently active.. one server only playing 2Fort, and one with the standerd map rotation.I really recommend that game. It makes fun and I really enjoy it. Its a bit harder to play than TF2, and without hats, but if you really want to feel the Team Fortress feeling, try this one here out you'll be suprised of how good this game still is these days.Its really worth its like 10 bucks here on steam.If I should give it a rarting, I would give it a 9/10. Its not perfect, but it still stands out of most of the shooters these days.

number of helpful: 8 of 9 people (89%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												This game is a very good representation of the original FPS games out there. First, this game was a Quake mod and then developed to it's own game, leaving us Team Fortress Classic. This game has all the thrill of games like Deathmatch Classic, Counter Strike, and Quake. The diversity of the classes is what makes this game the most fun. Instead of having to worry about overpowered weapons, this game is completely equal because everyone has the stock weapons, period. I purchased this game to see what came before the game, Team Fortress 2, in which I play frequently. This game is an all-around classic and is one of the best FPS games i've played, dispite it's age. Pretty much as long as you are into First Person Shooters or games like that, you'll enjoy this one. On the downside, Valve doesn't actually have official servers like they do in Counter Strike: Global Offensive or Team Fortress 2, and are all Third Party Community Servers, but as long as you find a good server, that's all that matters. If you are apprehensive of purchasing this because of the graphics, don't be. It's like that because it's old, and remember that the gameplay makes up for it. I promise you, as long as you keep playing and don't give up you'll like it. It may take you a few hours to get as good as you are at other FPS games, because at the beginning, you're not going to be so hot. One thing for TF2 players, there isn't hats or any way to waste your money. So just remember that one purchase is it. Anyway, as long as you are open minded to trying this game out, you should enjoy this game very much.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2016
												the classic fortress shooter. Team Fortress Classic is a class- and team-based multiplayer online first-person shooter video game developed by Valve and published by Sierra Studios. A port of the Team Fortress mod for Quake/QuakeWorld, Team Fortress Classic was originally released for Windows on April 1, 1999 as a mod for Half-Life and based on the Half-Life Engine (Gold Source Engine). A standalone version was later released on January 16, 2003. The development of Team Fortress Classic was led by John Cook and Robin Walker, two of the three designers from Team Fortress.The game itself involves a number of teams, each with access to ten classes, competing in a variety of modes such as Capture the Flag, Control Point, and Escort. In June 2000, the game underwent a significant upgrade, adding new player character models and game modes. As of 2003, the game was one of the ten most played Half-Life mods according to GameSpy. Today, as with its predecessor, Quake Team Fortress, it is not very active, and as such, there are few servers with humans on them, and bots prosper in the majority of servers. Your server browser can pick up at most 100 or more servers.

number of helpful: 12 of 17 people (71%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 24, 2015
												Team Fortress Classic is Valve’s second game in their “Classic” series, this one is a remake of the unofficial online shooter built off of Quake and QuakeWorld.The game was a really good idea and it all comes together pretty well, all of the classes are refined to feel more unique and are redesigned to look more like distinguished characters rather than a bunch of Quake Rangers with different suits.Team Fortress never had any maps, so they followed what Counter-Strike did and remade 3 popular custom maps that the community previously made as followed: 2 Fortresses, Canalzone, and the Rock. And they’ve all been completely remade to be more modern and they look great.Same follows with the modes, all the new and official modes are based from the unofficial modes such as Dustbowl and Crossover.There isn’t much more to say other than the fact that the whole game just feels like a huge tribute to Quake and it’s fans that contributed to Team Fortress and helped shape what it is known as today, then turned it into a very well-polished stand-alone shooter.The game is $4.99 and it’s a must-have for anybody who played and enjoyed the original, but I don’t recommend it if you don’t even have a clue what Quake is to begin with.

content:
Posted: February 17, 2015
												Team Fortress Classic is a FPS developed and released by Valve Corporation in 1999. It is the sequel to the popular Quake mod, Team Fortress, now remade with the Half-Life engine. And it is the prequel to our favorite Party Simulator, Team Fortress 2. Matches in Team Fortress Classic pit two teams against each other, with each team member having access to nine distinct classes. Competition takes place in a variety of scenarios, usually capture the flag, VIP protection, or territorial control. Since its release, the game has undergone significant upgrades to player models and game modes.I'll just say it right now guys, this game is GREAT. The classes, the graphics (Aged rather well, considering it was 99), the fast action and variety of weapons etc. I think it's actually near perfect.....Gameplay-wise.What really brings the game down to me is the fact that now it's almost empty. If you want proof, open up Counter Strike 1.6 and take a look at the servers. Then, open up TFC and take a look at the servers. Sad, sad indeed. And the only servers with actual people are full of people that are probably going to kick your♥♥♥♥♥big time, no mercy will be shown, so you have 3 choices: Get good, get good or GIT GUD, these guys can't even be considered simple veterans, these guys probably know the game better than the creators themselves. The game is really different from TF2 so don't think it's all going to be sunshine and rainbows, the gameplay is faster, no hats, no other weapons and the game doesn't get all the updates and attention TF2 receives every day. You know what this means? Almost no people in the servers and unbalanced gameplay at some points because of no patches (Grenades, Bhopping and MEDIC, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ IT MEDIC). However, if you want to play a solid FPS, that, in my personal opinion, would be way better than Counter Strike 1.6 (Yes, I f.u.c.king said that.) if it only had more people. PLAY THIS, it's an absolute must for any FPS fan and an overlooked, underrated gem nowadays.9/10

content:
Posted: April 20, 2016
												Team Fortress Classic is a complete joy. At first it's a hard game to jump into and can be quite annoying from time to time. There are many things that make this game what it is.First off, this game set the standard for what every class-based shooter should be. From the fast-running scout to the hefty Heavy Weapons Guy, this game introduces most-needed diversity in what any game should have to keep it running, and to keep players playing. Sometimes, however, it just doesn't seem like the classes are doing what they should. On maps like 2fort (CTF) or Dustbowl (TC), the Medics are the ones that are the guys pushing the flag by using their frag and concussion grenades to propel themselves towards the capture point, rendering the Scout useless and completely diverts the MEDIC'S role away from what it seems.The game play of this game will keep you sitting at your desk for hours on hours. The on-going struggle to carry a piece of cloth on a pole to an enemy base will be as if you're running with a piece of pie dangling in front of you -- Long and annoying at first, but rewarding in the end. The stalemates of the grenade tosses at the beginning of matches can be aggravating, but you'll feel like a secret agent slipping through as a spy.Overall, this game is absolutely marvelous, and will live on forever. This game is worth the five bucks, it's tons of fun, and it will keep you entertained for years to come.

content:
Posted: March 5, 2015
												Is this game bad? No. This game is obviously a good little shooter that was once THE king of online gaming before the mod known as Counter-Strike came along and it was replaced by the admittedly better Team Fortress 2. But why did I not recommend it? Because fifteen years ago this game was FULL of players well into the 2000s. Now only a special few still play the game. It's a shame because its actually quite a nice little gem to have in your inventory and show off to your friends.Pros:- A good selection of weapons that you wouldn't find in Team Fortress 2 (Pyro has a fire nuke!)- Pure nostalgia entering servers that are 10 years old and still have Scatman music playing in the background.- One shot snipers.- Much harder to play and understand. Very rewarding.Cons:- Unfortunately those same weapons I mentioned before do barely any damage. (Pyros Flamethrower does 3dmg!)- Serious balance issues (Pyro is the worst class in the game)- GRENADES. THEY SHOULDN'T EXIST IN A GAME LIKE THIS.- Hardly anyone plays anymore.Overall you should spend that five bucks if you truly want to see what this game is about. Otherwise I would be recommending Team Fortress 2 or any of the other First Person Shooters.Also to any Aussie players, there is one local server but it has a password on it. Thus you may need to use the US servers.

content:
Posted: April 2
												Hello Fellow Operatives,Team Fortress Classic is an alright game. I find it interesting how a serious game like this became what we know as Team Fortress 2, but it's interesting to see the original. Honestly, the two are almost nothing alike. The classes in this game don't really have any particular differences other than a few weapons, health and armor, but that's just about it. Team Fortress 2 offers a much bigger variety, especially in servers. It's a good game, but it's basically another Half-Life Deathmatch: Source but with classes and different weapons. I like how all of the classes are there that are there in Team Fortress 2, I find it interesting how the game developed to give us the game so man people love now. It's definitely a good game, but it's definitely outdated. It's nothing like Team Fortress 2 really, so if you were looking at this because of that, I suggest that you move along. It is definitely worth the money if you know for sure what the game is like prior to buying, though!-Kyle James

												Played it many years ago with friends and recently tried it again. Nostalgia is strong in this game. I would probably compare Team Fortress Classic to as much great game as Team Fortress 2 were before hats and all stuff. There is just one thing different: Classic one stayed as great and fun game. There is only one problem, as probably in every old multiplayer game: players. No, TF Classic isn't empty, there are still people to play with together. The problem is, there are rarely new faces and only pro people are left. Sure, looking at reviews somebody is playing it and doesn't have 1k+ hours in it, but most of those people are probably similar to me: played it years ago, want to check how it is and compare it to TF2. Still, there are so many interesting mods and maps for this, that even playing some of them alone and/or with bots would be fun.Maybe it's not free like TF2, but it's worth checking out. In bundles with other Valve games you can grab it for really low prices (and at sales the price is REALLY low) so even if you won't spend many hours on it, you won't regret checking it out.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 22, 2014
Team Fortress Classic is class-based multiplayer FPS developed as a mod for the original Half-Life. There are ten classes to choose from, each of them with varying strengths, weaknesses and abilities, Although one of them is literally useless and only appears in one game mode as a target. There is a heavy emphasis on teamwork between players of different classes requiring a well-balanced offence and defence. The game modes can revolve around capturing the flag, territory captures, or protecting a VIP. Typically, players have the choice of two teams (Red and Blue) with a maximum of 32 players in a server .Team Fortress Classic is much like Team Fortress 2 , and it still has hundreds of servers running so you won't find it difficult to find yourself servers to play .  Triskelion Turbella Reviews

Posted: November 20, 2016
												I've played this game for thousands of hours, since 2005. It's a very fast paced game, if you want it to be. There are many different classes which you can learn to adapt to your gaming style. The easiest class to start is a sniper. The skill is to learn to use any class in any situation. The community used to be top notch. Nowadays there are less and less people playing. TFC needs new blood. There are many different maps and modes, like CTF, CP. There are also many fun maps, where you f.e. can climb, explore, and solve mysteries. In short, TFC is a simple yet complicated game. If you like a challenge, pick it up.

content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
												Team Fortress Classic is the predecessor of the Free to Play game we all know and love, Team Fortress 2. It is a team-based FPS very much like TF2. It was originally a mod based on the 1996 game Quake and was eventually adopted by Valve to be it's own game in 1999. Hell, this game is as old as I am. Runnin on the Source engine, this game is one of, if not, the best game Valve has ever made. It's gameplay of having classes is what makes it stand out from the rest of the FPS games we all see nowadays. It has changed the gaming world and still is to this day with TF2. There are games out there like Battleborn and Overwatch that take on the class-based approach to FPS's, but none of them can compare to Team Fortress. If you're a die-hard Valve fan such as myself, then you NEED to buy yourself a copy of this staple in FPS gaming history!

content:
Posted: January 5, 2013
												While it may not be as alove as Team Fortress 2, Team Fortress Classic, or TFC for short, cleary remains unique and fun. Compared to TF2, TFC has gamemodes that won't be present in TF2 (such as escort, reverse capture the flag), awesome maps (such as rock2 and hunted, very well made maps that were not included in TF2, unforunately) and the 10th class, the civilian.Sure now you may be wondering "Why should I buy an old almost dead game when his brother is free and alive?". By playing it, not only you may keep the game alive for a while longer, but also may find a great game for your free time and maybe even making more people look with interest at it.I love TF2, I came to TFC from TF2, but honestly I got more used to TFC and it would be such a shame if you wouldn't give this game a chance. There are also various fun-adventure servers, which you may like, but overall this game was a masterpiece in his time and it would be such a shame to die now.

												Team Fortress Classic is a sequel/remake of the Quake mod, Team Fortress. You have nine playable classes, and different game modes such as capture the flag, capture points, and more.Pros:-All classes are fun to play as-Good graphics for the Gold Source engine-Lots of fun weapons such as the minigun, super nailgun, sentry gun-Mostly good community-Nice orchestral sountrack-Spies can feign death-Set many things that would appear in Team Fortress 2-Fantastic default maps-Easy for TF2 fans to play if you don't mind lack of taunts and hatsCons:-Some TF2 fans go on it and say annoying things like "Wer ar al deh hatz?!" and "Dis game suks cuz of itz graficks!!"-TF2 is slightly better and free-Really bad custom maps show up occasionally-GLITCHES-Grenade hacksOverall rating: 9/10

content:
Posted: March 13, 2015
												Back in '99, we did not have cable internet yet, the only way for me to go online was to go to the library. At one point, I just connected my computer to the phone line and played some games online like Unreal Tournament and Half Life. Afterwards I read something in a magazine about this Team Fortress mod, so I downloaded and installed it. It was great fun, untill my parents received the phone bill at the end of the month..When I did get cable internet, later that year, I spend quite some time playing Team Fortress. A first person shooter in which every one has his own role/skills, which was never been done before. Obviously, there are not that many players in TFclassic anymore. It's still a fun game but with the dated graphics and TF2 being free2play, there is no reason to go back to TFclassic but for nostalgia sake. I still recommend this game for what it used to be but be sure you got some friends to play with.

content:
Posted: January 12, 2014
												I enjoyed TF2, but TFC is the ultimate brother here. TFC follows the same rules as before, 9 classes, two teams, hundreds of maps, and a lot of killing. TF2 I never liked due to the serious unbalancing of the game, and yes TFC is a tad unbalanced too, but TF2 took it too far. That being said, It's nice to play TFC because I feel as if newcomers have a slighter chance of getting kills, BUT, if you are a newcomer, YOU WILL BE CRUSHED because this game is a tad dead meaning many experienced players do play this. As far as I know, there are about only 5 dedicated servers left for REAL players only, no bots. Drippy's 2fort is one of them that always seem populated, but I hope you don't mind playing 2fort for awhile since that seems to be the only popular real server left.The graphics are from Half Life 1, sooo you should get an idea of what it looks like. As for sound, nothing really, just explosions, guns being shot off, turrents, doors opening, grunts from jumping, ETC.The gameplay in this does require a bit more skill so mastering it is really hard. Snipers will pick you off instantly, Soldiers will destroy you, ETC. Haha, the gameplay is quite fun though, but remember, each class isn't for everybody, so you may need to experiment some if you wanna figure out what's best for you. My favorite is the Scout and Engineer. My only complaint in this game...are the grenades. As much as I love TFC, the grenades are absolutely overpowered and spammed to hell. The thing about grenades are that their blast radius is HUGE and people spam them everywhere. In 2fort, I have been killed too much by opening a door and having a grenade thrown at me and having me killed. Grenade spamfest is almost the name of the game, but once you get used to it, this game is downright fun and awesome.Sure, this game is sadly dying, but there are still some servers left for real players, there is a server that hosts Dustbowl 24/7 for real players too and it's the second most popular server so if you get bored of 2fort from Drippy's, there is always that server. So help us TFC lovers bring this classic back to life by buying it. It's only $5.00, and it will offer you hours of fun on end. Many sleepless night I've had on TFC, trust me. I have almost 50 hours in this game and I know that I will still keep playing more in the future. So buy TFC today! You have nothing to lose other than your social life.

content:
Posted: September 15, 2015
												This game isnt dead whatsoever. You'll see at least 2 full servers per day. This game IS NOT like TF2, I repeat, NOT LIKE TF2. The only similarites between the two TF games are the classes and maps. Nothing else.Grenades are very important on the battlefield.This is a great game if you want to see TFC and enjoy the thrilling expirience.In TF2, Spy isn't a relatively hard class to master , but in TFC, it is quite the opposite. No cloak, no instant disguise. However, It is rewarding seeing enemies splatter ang gib upon a backstab. Instead of a revolver, Spy gets a weak nailgun, a super shotgun, and a tranq pistol.Other classes follow suit.There's no fancy hats, different loadouts, or anything. Just plain default.So, if that seems good for you, get TFC. If not, you can stick to Hat Simulator. ( still pretty fun )

												Team Fortress Classic is the 1st game in the Team Fortress Series. From a player transitioning from TF2 to TFC it was hard. But once you get over that steep learning curve, the game will open up to you. You will start appreciating it and understand why a lot of fans say that this game is better than TF2.Gameplay: 7/10

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2012
												Team Fortress Classic was the game that introduced me to true teamplay and organized gaming. It was the first game I played where the best player on the server could have a 5-50 score and still be the guy winning the game.Despite a number of design flaws the game somehow manages to work and provide a highly competitive experience. You pick one of the 9 classes and work together through varying CTF style maps to beat another equal team. The classes don't all work like you would think though, however many years of competitive play have managed to fit most of them into suitable roles, or marked as being completely useless. Medics don't heal but cap points and heavies are completely useless.Despite all of this it's still a game I cherish. Today there might not be any people left playing but once upon a time this was the premier game for skill and teamwork.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 4, 2013
												Note: I put more hours into this on another account that I owned.If I had to choose between Team Fortress Classic and Team Fortress 2, I would go with Team Fortress Classic. Although I wasn't too big on it at first, I eventually began to prefer Classic over TF2. In fact, I think that it's actually more worth it to pay the $4.99 you need to buy this game than to freely download TF2. Yes, it lacks TF2's interesting characters, but it packs a punch with its gameplay that is even more challenging than TF2, not to mention that it's also more balanced. Only real problem with the game is that it lacks a lot of online players, and the servers that are still up aren't always the greatest. Still, TFC is worth the $4.99 you spend on it.

content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												The sequel to the game that started it all, this is Team Fortress Classic - the second game in the series.As usual you get control of nine classes, as well as the "Hunted" class in the "Hunted" gamemode. Each map has a different objective, capture flags, protect vips, kill vips.The game isn't quite dead, it has a server or two with quite a lot of people, while others are... are in complete control by the BOTS! They have no latency, and are hunting you for all your goodie bags!Overall...9/10"Outstanding"

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 1, 2015
												This game is HIGHLY overlooked by its free to play sequel, Team Fortress 2. It is a little hard to find a lot of people to play the game with, but when you though, this game can be really fun! This game is a charming little shooter, and is quite straight to the point. Each character is set up to be balanced with their own unique abilities. There is no unfare/overpowered/exploited characters, it is completely balanced, and is not about the stats. This is a game that I can simply pick up and play a round or two. I love this games and I think more people should try it. The graphics may be a little outdated, but the gameplay is just as good as a modern game.  If you like a good first person shooter without screaming 12 year olds and fair gameplay, then I recommend this hidden gem to you!

content:
Posted: June 7, 2016
Product received for free
												This game isn't the original Team Fortress, but it isn't tf2. It's a weird mix of old quake-style games and newer games like, well, tf2. It's hard to get used to since the graphics are a bit disorienting, but after you get used to it it's not bad. It doesn't really make sense that this costs money though, considering tf2 is free. I would only reccomend it to tf2 fans who want something familiar, yet different.Also, lots of people are saying there aren't many people still playing, but I've had no real trouble with that. It's something to keep in mind though.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 3, 2015
												Lag? Not a problem. You and your enemies have higher health than your modern day twitch shooter. Also the netcode is amazing! You would probably have a smooth gameplay if you entered a lobby with 150+ ping anyways, so don't let your ping scare you. You will engage in actual gun battles, not a "who saw who first." Don't like being a slayer? no problem! you can sometimes run past enemeis throwing yourself at the objective with almost no penalty. You can use mic or text chat. There are a lot of buttons, but don't let this overwelm you! You mostly will just jump, shoot and throw a grenade. Pure FPS fun without all of the b.s. Highly reccomend it to anyone in the NTSC/EU regions (US/Canada/Mexico/UK etc. and my game time lol this is from steam using this steam account. I've been playing it since 2002 off and on (casually).

content:
Posted: July 7, 2014
												Okay... Listen up maggots!Today we're going into Team Fortress Classic! Many of you here today have spent some time in Team Fortress 2. Well, I want you to forget most of what you learned. Team Fortress 2 will seem like a teaparty compared to the brutal war that awaits you in Classic. You are all equally vulnerable the second you step onto that field of war. There are many features that you may have gotten used to in Team Fortress 2. But I ask you, what makes a game? A staggering amount of useless hats, unusual weapons, and silly taunts? Hell no! Now I can't promise enjoyment from all of you. Perhaps a few of you Next-gen wussies will dismiss this as nostalgic garbage. But I assure you, the ones that make it through, you will enjoy every cent spent on this game.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												TFC is madness in a can, sometimes you just need to pop the lid. No matter what class you play, when you get to the frontline tactics often go right out the window when you're trying to kill the guy next to you that seems to be singlehandedly beating your team back. There's often not time to think, you purely react, and subconsciously improve your skill in the traits of your class. The veterans whizz about the map rocket-jumping with incredible accuracy of direction as snipers pick them out of the sky with their patiently charged up shots. Grenades expertly fused and thrown while on the run, and detonation packs blow up with split second perfect timing as gates open. I'm always in awe of the sharpened skills displayed by a flag holder blasting himself through the map, right onto the capture point. This is old, but gameplay is better than graphics. All I can ask is that people still play it, and that it runs in widescreen on Win7. Yes, yes, and yes!

Posted: July 6, 2015
												This game is so great. I know you TF2 fans are going to get mad at me. But I personally find this game better than TF2. I think TFC community is a whole lot better and friendly compared to TF2. I also love the fact that on TFC. You focus on team working. That's right they're are no hats, no microtransaction crap... I know this game takes awhile to get used to. But, Its worth it in the end. Plus there are no taunt distractions (I'm talking about you conga taunt). None of that. And I like the mods people do and people still play this game. :) Plus I think this game requires more skill which I think why TF2 fans are scared of it. If you compare this to TF2. TF2 is just an easy game and really no skill involved compared to TFC. Anyways, if your angry about TF2. I'd recommand those people to play this game instead its tons of fun! :) By the way.... WHO CARES IF THE GRAPHICS ARE OUTDATED TF2 FANS!!!

content:
Posted: November 25, 2010
												Valve rather blatantly ripped off the fan-made mod Fortress Forever with this game, but that's okay, because they did a great job. The move away from the clunky Source engine makes all the crazy movement tricks much smoother to pull off, and the general feel of the game is improved, especially when you take into account the vastly reduced loading times and system requirements. There is also more character in this installment, which has bloodier gibs, more distinctive maps, and a generally fresh feeling, which Fortress Forever can only hint at. Frankly, TFC makes Fortress Forever feel like a cheap knockoff itself.

content:
Posted: November 25, 2010
												Valve rather blatantly ripped off the fan-made mod Fortress Forever with this game, but that's okay, because they did a great job. The move away from the clunky Source engine makes all the crazy movement tricks much smoother to pull off, and the general feel of the game is improved, especially when you take into account the vastly reduced loading times and system requirements. There is also more character in this installment, which has bloodier gibs, more distinctive maps, and a generally fresh feeling, which Fortress Forever can only hint at. Frankly, TFC makes Fortress Forever feel like a cheap knockoff itself.

content:
Posted: February 22, 2014
												This is a very fun first-person-shooter. This comes from a person who mainly likes half-realistic games like Counter-Strike. The graphics are of course dated 1999, includes whacky physics and animations, also voice chat will make your character's mouth move. Sounds are mostly recycled from Half-Life, aswell as the robotic announcer. Gameplay is a ton of fun, not too realistic, you have your 9 classes all with different roles, a handful of different game modes and maps. There aren't many active servers with players, so you'll play against third-party bots most of the time, but you would get your a** kicked if there were some TFC Veterans in here still. This game also screams teamwork, not like teamwork in Call of Duty, but also not like teamwork in Left 4 Dead. TL;DR, Little multi-player-only, semi-futuristic, first-person-shooter that is not too active, but even 15+ years after date, is still fun to play.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2012
												Abandon (almost) everything you know about Team Fortress 2, because this remake of the original mod is more to Quake (the game the original Team Fortress mod was based apon) than it's financial titan of a sequel (prequel?).This game is fast paced and has grenades. What more is there to know? Well, for one thing, it is the ghetto of multiplayer FPS'. Meaning, functions such as objective mechanics and pre-round/round time are map-based, and time is not shown on the HUD, it's generally shown through a server-side command. Other than that, it's quite fun, if not unfogiving, but what fun is there in a game if it offers you little challenge and doesn't punish you for not meeting said challenge?I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys fast-paced team-centric gameplay, unfortunately it's not exactally bursting with players every day. Most servers are full of bots, and the one that don't have mods that, while not always detering from the gameplay, tend to not retain the original gameplay fully.Needs Steam Trading Cards. That would attract new players. Or not. Never know.

content:
Posted: August 25, 2012
												Abandon (almost) everything you know about Team Fortress 2, because this remake of the original mod is more to Quake (the game the original Team Fortress mod was based apon) than it's financial titan of a sequel (prequel?).This game is fast paced and has grenades. What more is there to know? Well, for one thing, it is the ghetto of multiplayer FPS'. Meaning, functions such as objective mechanics and pre-round/round time are map-based, and time is not shown on the HUD, it's generally shown through a server-side command. Other than that, it's quite fun, if not unfogiving, but what fun is there in a game if it offers you little challenge and doesn't punish you for not meeting said challenge?I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys fast-paced team-centric gameplay, unfortunately it's not exactally bursting with players every day. Most servers are full of bots, and the one that don't have mods that, while not always detering from the gameplay, tend to not retain the original gameplay fully.Needs Steam Trading Cards. That would attract new players. Or not. Never know.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 6, 2016
												It's a solid team-based Half-Life mod. I have played it for hundreds of hours and it's still a fun game. The classes have very clear-cut purposes and roles, e.g. Scout has almost no weapons while being the best flag capturer of the game and a soldier can nail you to a wall with rockets if you get too close to it and sniper is the only class that can do anything to a long range targets due to the default weapon being a shotgun. Even if you die, you are back in action in a second. The gameplay is very simple with no gimmicks or obscure gameplay mechanics as it is basically a re-skinned and modified Half-Life DM, making it very newbie friendly and not frustrating to start. The only not self-evident things in the game are the demolition charge of demoman to blow up unmarked targets and the building mechanics of engineer.

Posted: June 26, 2015
												If you play Team Fortress 2, it's definately a step back. However if you are like me and you don't have a good gaming PC, this game is perfect if you like Team Fortress 2. The grapics are lower quality, but they take up less space and are more friendly to those that are still using DSL. If you like shooters and have a terrible computer and internet connection, this may be the perfect game for you. If you are able to play Team Fortress 2, I reccomend staying away from this game since it costs money and Team Fortress 2 is free.

Team Fortress Classic Reviewby KTMboyz"Let me explain..."Okay!  Yes, I don't recommend the game, why?  Well, that's what I'm going to talk about.  Can I start by pointing out that the game is dead!  You will be lucky enough to find a match with 1 to 5 people on it.  "But, that's just because its old!  Surely it was a popular and fun game at the time?" I hear you say.  Well, in a way.  Team Fortress Classic was overshadowed by the monster hit:  Counter-Strike.  If you compare the two, Team Fortress Classic is a mess...  Unlike its sequel, the characters are not memorable, the weapons sound terrible in my opinion and so on...  When I do find a game, its actually pretty fun...  Sometimes...?  I don't know, this is my opinion and I personally feel like the game is not very polished and seems unfinished.  I will point out I haven't even played for two hours XD, so my opinion might change.  Pick it up if you liked the game or have lots of memories from before.  If your some TF2/CoD kid looking for another game, well, probably not...  Sorry.8.5/10

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 7, 2015
												Grenade Spam everywhere, unbalanced classes, nearly dead community. 10/10On a more serious note I don't hate TFC, as I think it is a good founding base for what would become TF2. However what kills this game of a recommendation from me is the nearly dead community. At most there is 20 to 30 players spread across different servers, and most of the time there is only 15 or so players on different servers. I dislike other things though like the grenade spam, the annoying medic poison (which is pretty op) and the classes having weaknesses that outweigh the pros of the class. Same thing with other classes having to many pros and not enough cons. Like some the weapons feel like you are hitting your enemy's with rubber bullets. But you know what for what it is, it certainly isn't bad. But when TF2 is vastly superior and the community is nearly dead, it's a hard sell.

Posted: April 26, 2016
												Team Fortress Classic is a really good game I gotta admit I hop on it every so often but I cannot recommend it. Why? Because it's so difficult to understand. There is no feedback and its so hard to tell whats going on in matches because its so fast paced. Its hard to explain but if you try it yourself you will know exactly what I mean. Experienced players get a huge advantage over everyone especially with grenades in the game. The learning curve is so steep that it's not even a curve... It's a wall... However if you're good at games like quake or half-life then I defilently recommend this!!!

content:
Posted: September 5, 2015
												If you are more familiar with TF2 like me... okay, if you started with TF2 like me then you'd have to be curious about Team Fortress Classic and well... it's just not worth it. It just doesn't hold up today, not for people like me.I probably haven't played it for long enough of course, but do I have to? It's more fast paced sure, but more complicated. Over-complicated, even. It's unbalanced and the GoldSrc engine itself just has weird depth perception... Oh yeah, and nobody plays it anymore. I mean, there are barely any servers with human beings on it for me.Yes, I know there are still people that like TFC, people that have been raised on TFC the same way I and many others were raised on TF2. And if you're one of them, good for you! That's fine with me. But I just don't like it myself. I'm going to stick with TF2. It's still much better balanced, more simple and it has hundreds of servers that people still play on today.If you're curious to see what TFC looks like, then I won't stop you from getting it yourself. Just don't say I didn't warn you.

content:
Posted: April 10, 2016
												This game may have been good when it came out, but now it's dead. Firstly there is a better-looking more dynamic and more entertaining sequel which is free. If for some reason you want to play the maps from this game, just play one that has been ported into TF2. If you want to play the classes in their original unbalanced state, just play Fortress Forever, which is free. My friend and I tried playing this game, and there's about 5 people left who play it. They don't even play the actual game- just weird obstacle courses which don't function properly. You can do that on Roblox. Roblox is free. My point is, don't buy this game.

number of helpful: 0 of 4 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2015
												I really wanted to like it, but it's just too archaic and weirdly designed. Some examples:-Some options, like cursors, have to be changed out of game. I don't like the default cursor, and I don't want to jump through hoops to replace it. I understand that that's on me, but it still annoys me.-Infenction.-Why have friendly fire as an option when the game includes a class that can disguise as a teammate? I've only been able to get matches on servers that have it, and that annoys me. The lighting also makes it really hard to differentiate enemies from allies, leading to more frustration.Other:-Not a ton of players, unfortunately. There's plently, but not as many as I'd like.-Some classes are just plain bad, and not worth playing from my point of view.The Good:-Weapon variety. There's a lot of cool weapons.-General things, like engine and map design.-Not as commercialized as the Hat Game, and the weapons are slightly more balanced as a result.The game is quite fun, but I now know why it evolved the way it did. If you can get it in a pack with other games, it's worth it. Even at full price, I'd recommend it; just be prepared for a rough game that might annoy you if you're used to the super-polished TF2.All of this is my opinion, and some of it might be completely wrong. This is just my perspective. As a scrub/derty casul, I'd just prefer playing the more polished game.

Posted: February 26, 2015
												Hear me out i feel if you've never played TF2 you could get used to this game, but if you have played TF2 then you will not enjoy this. I noticed alot of servers werent even full and the ones that were are laggy, not bad laggy but when your fighting its a huge streak the will just freeze everything. I sort of enjoyed this game it is very much like TF2 but different, ALSO if you have played TF2 your skills will not transfer you will be like the normal bad player in TF2. Over all i give this game for people who havent played tf2 a 8/10 but for the ones who have a 5/10. I dont recomend buying this game but if you put alot of time and effort you will master Team Fortress Classic.

content:
Posted: May 5, 2014
												This is great nostalgic pack for Team Fortress series. But there is a huge problem in this game and that's playability which causes me to not recommend it.When paying REAL money for the game, you'd expect yourself to be able to actually play the game. I bought this, didn't find any servers and after few hours, I found one where I had like 300 ms ping and getting constant lag spikes and sometimes even disconnects due to the server being located in someone's home PC in Alaska or something. I'm not sure have others came across this problem but from my experience, it feels ridiculous that you pay for a game that you can't even play.Making this game free-to-play would make me recommend it. It's an awesome game but what's the point buying an awesome game if you can't even play it?Sorry, dislike, I have to.

number of helpful: 10 of 25 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2013
												While I haven't gotten too much into the game, I dont think I will be getting far. Yes, this is probably a good game and I'm just bad at it. I will say this though; if you have experience in the sequel to this game, Team Fortress 2, then don't bother buying this. There are so many things different in this than TF2, so nothing applies from that game except for the classes. Again, this isn't a bad game, its just that anyone who stuck around before TF2 has become too good at this game, and anyone going into it from TF2 will get a very bad experience.So if you have not played TF2 before,try it out and see how it goes.But if you HAVE played TF2 before, save your money for some keys.

number of helpful: 5 of 15 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 27, 2014
												Wow. Just wow. While this game is a "milestone of fps", this game has aged badly. The controls are just bad, some class feel waaaay more usefull as others (I'm looking at you, Demoman and Scout.) And just everything is bland. Besides a couple of levels, there was nothing that made this game any different from other fpses. No crazy customazation or weapons, just nothing. To top it all off, the servers for this game are just DESERTED. With luck, the most you'll find is 5 people. Overall, I can see why this game is considered a classic, but it's doing a really bad job of showing me. All I can say is skip TF and go directly to 2. It's unique, it's funny, and did I mention it's free? I'm sorry TF, but I think it's time to be put down.Pros: I can see innovatation for it's time.. +Cons: ..But it's no longer 1999. And it's aged badly. -          Generic. -          Some classes are useful, and then some are just downright bad. -          No good stages.OVERALL SCORE: 3/10.RECOMMEND: No. Just get TF2.
