content:
Posted: May 17, 2014
												7.5/10***Yes, this is a good game however it hurts my heart to make it not recommended. The gameplay, mechanics, physics, and everything about this bundle of joy is amazing, and very enjoyable. Although I have not recommended this game, I still give it a strong 7.5/10. The reason I cannot recommend this is because of the more recent creation of Team Fortress 2, the Team Fortess Classic community is dying out. It's difficult to find a password-free, public server with a decent amount of players on it. If you do see a server with 'players', there's a possibility that the 'players' are bots, therefore abysmal at the game. On the rare occasion, you might find a server that actually has players on it. This is ALSO a problem. The likeliness is high that the players on the server are very good Team Fortress Classic players, and have years of experience. As a latecomer, it is very difficult to become even decent at the game because of the simple fact you get completely anialated by all of the other players. One thing I must note is that, if you are a good, or even the best Team Fortress 2 player in the world, don't get this game with high-expectations. The combat style is very different, and very fast-paced. Even with years of experience in Team Fortress 2 it takes much time and dedication to get good at this game, and be able to have fair fights with other players. Another thing which is enjoyable is that despite the fact some players are very good, all of the loadouts for each class are the same, therefore every player in theory should have an equal chance, however this obviously varies on the fact some players are extremely good, like I previously mentioned.NOTE: The reason I have low playtime on this game is because I had it and used to play it before steam began to count playtime. Even before steam existed. I would take a rough estimate and say that I have between 150-200 hours of playtime in this game total.

number of helpful: 4 of 13 people (31%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 8, 2014
												TL; DR Game hasn't aged well, play TF2.Let me start by saying I wanted to like this game. I had a positive bias before I even played it.I tried many times to get into this game, and every time I gave up.The problem with this game isn't that it's old, it's a combination of little things that make it a chore to play.You can't tell when you hit someone.You can't tell if you killed someone or if someone else did.The grenades have such horrible physics you might as well just be throwing a laggy pillow.You also can't tell when a grenade hits someone.The classes are horribly imbalanced and bland, pyro's MAIN weapon has almost no hit registration and is given a rocket launcher to compensate.The spy is nearly useless since you need to open a menu and USE YOUR MOUSE to disguise.Nearly all the classes have some kind of shotgun.The scout's nailgun never hits.The demoman's detpack is useless except in extreme circumstances.The pipe bombs have the same fluffy pillow technology as the grenades.You can't tell any class apart from each other.Everyone sounds the same.There's no personality, it's a bland brown shooter.The skill levels between players differ so greatly that trying to start out is nearly impossible because you die every 2 seconds.Bunnyhopping.I can see why this game would have been great 15 years ago, but now so many games outclass it there's no point in playing it. If you want a fast paced shooter that has fixed almost all of these issues, play the sequel Team Fortress 2. It's free.

												Well. This game is old, and it kinda shows. I wasn't around in the time it was released, but TFC was probably great back then, just like Half-Life deathmatch was. But was is the key word here, it really hasn't aged well. On modern computers it's unstable and glitchy. I found myself invincible at times, constantly at 1 HP at others, walking backwards through walls. The community with it isn't great either. They're all just judgemental, calling new or unexperienced players "♥♥♥♥♥♥s". Hating on the superior (but faithful) sequel, TF2, for it's expansive cosmetic item service and it's popularity. I understand that back in the day many people loved this, but it can't keep up with, well, TF2. I don't reccomend this to anyone other than the purpose of nostalgia. And yeah, that's a fine reason to like or buy a game, I rebought Sonic Adventure, twice. But I don't think that one's aged well either.

												I personally can't find much to say about the game, since there are never any active servers to play on. It's not that TFC is a bad game, it's just that it's very old and doesn't attract as big of a player base as it did all those years ago. It's a well-made game and the class roles are unique. If you can find a server to play on or are willing to set up a LAN party with friends, then I'm sure you'll have a lot of fun with this game. Otherwise, you're better off going with another class-based shooter from a more recent era, such as the fantastic sequel, Team Fortress 2.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												TF2 isn't much of a "game" anymore, but more of a conga sim where you get banned for not being "friendly," so I eventually picked this thing up hoping for TF2 without the roblox community.What I got wasn't what I was expecting, but great nonetheless.  TFC is a quake-style shooter, nothing to it.  Low skill floor, high skill ceiling.  You may have a bit of trouble at first but as soon as you get a good understanding of bunnyhopping and the occasional grenade jump, you're ready to go.Perhaps it doesn't have a lot of players, but you know what?  No big deal.  This game's so much fun, I don't mind only seven servers.  As long as you avoid playing Drippy's 2fort, this game is just great all around, from its leftover quake mechanics to its completely different weapons and style.  Its gamemodes are also a lot of fun-- a Dustbowl where you carry YOUR OWN flag to each point, the insta-capping 5 point Warpath, the civilian escort mission Hunted, and the base assault mission Ravelin.With many more crazy game mechanics, such as engie's building detonation and the demoman's Detpack that can both be a timebomb and a secret path opener, this game is a must-have for someone looking for a good semi-teambaesd multiplayer deathmatch that focuses on objectives rather than KDR.Either join an existing server or make your own using Half-Life's dedicated server tool and make a group for this game, it's up to you.Speaking of Half-Life, did you know once you buy this game you can find all the HL1 soundtrack in the files?  Well, now you do.  Now get fragging!Shameless group promotion:If you're really having trouble finding players for this game, not to worry!  I've started a Steam group called R3VIVE Gaming, and we're entirely dedicated to playing HL1/GoldSrc games every Friday and Saturday night, occasionally being TFC... now at 165 members and counting!http://steamcommunity.com/groups/r3vivegamingCheck us out some time if you're looking for some TFC players, and you can use our Community Game Scheduling forum section to schedule your own matches with members.

content:
Posted: July 2, 2014
												Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with this game, it's just difficult to recommend.Team Fortress Classic is a frantic, but durable shooter. It requires a lot more movement and percision when compared to it's successor, TF2. The problem is, it's a bit too unbalanced in difficulty. Defending teams have a bit too much of an advantage, and the maps don't neccessarily suffice for both teams either. One side always has an advantage, and it doesn't help when teams are unbalanced due to the lack of players.The good thing is, combat still holds up today. New players will be familiar with the weapons, as most of them are similiar in control to their TF2 variants. If one is proficient at TF2, then the Classic classes shouldn't require too much struggle to master. Classic is definitely satisfying and exhilirating, especially when you assign the controls to your preferences. Aside from combat, not much else holds up honestly in Team Fortress Classic. It's fun, there's no doubt, but there's nothing here begging for a purchase. It doesn't hold up like Half-Life does, and it doesn't really hold the strong community needed to support dedicated play. Servers are generally sporadic, and the FoxBot mods only give you so much of an experience.The Verdict:Team Fortress Classic holds up well in gameplay, but the declining amount of players have diminished so much of the possibilities within the game. Many modes and mods have become obsolete, with only a few such as "Capture the Flag" surviving.Honestly, only buy Team Fortress Classic if you are a big fan of early 3D shooters like Quake or Doom. If you enjoy those games, Classic will be right up your ally. Just beware of an abundance of vacant servers.(EDIT: 3 thumbs down? C'mon people, don't be so biased. I was honest and said the game was good, but after being so outdated it's only accessible to certain audiences.)

Posted: June 25, 2015
												My review for TF2 can be seen here:http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198056186683/recommended/440This game isn't worth 0.99 let alont 3.99. I hope you don't have a pair of rose colored earbuds to go with those rose tinted goggles because if you do then I hate having to be the one to break this to you. The original Team Fortress sucked! Street Fighter 1 anyone? Oh yeah no one has played it either or ever should for that matter. Wow that was harsh. While not as bad as Street Fighter 1 it's hard to say it's worth playing (Especially in 2016) and to be honest I can't even say that I can see what could have made it a good game to begin with. You may say that it's inovative as it was a teamwork focused hero shooter way before Team Fortress 2 made it cool but even if the original did it first it also did it worst. I recall playing this more than a decade ago when it was bundled with Half-Life and a retail version of Counter Strike. Two out of those three games were awesome. Guess which one wasn't? The gunplay is awful, the maps are bad, the balance is nonexistant and the graphics even for it's time are just awful with no appeal what so ever unless you like the color brown and generic Quake wannabes. It has aged terribly and it about as much fun as playing Miscreated or Street Fighter 1. Stay away and play Team Fortress 2 instead.

												TFC is not like it's illustrious sequel TF2 in many  ways.The  menus can  be difficult to use.  A example of  this problem is when you change classes it can  sometimes tab out. This might be  due to settings on my computer so I am not saying it is a problem with  the  game.The sniper in TFC  can be difficult to play as the cross hair is tiny.Rocket jumping in TFC  is almost impossible as you will die from  the damage.Spy is basically broken in TFC  the slow menus  and the  speed of  the  game don't  work  well.Overall I  would not  recommend this game to  play, rather collect it for your steam library.I'm  a  big  fan  of  TF2  and  to find  out  how  it began was actually kinda funny.

content:
Posted: January 8, 2014
There was a couple from Texas who was planning a weekend trip across the Mexican border for a shopping spree. At the last minute, their baby-sitter canceled, so they had to bring along their two year old son with them. They had been across the border for an hour when the boy got free and ran around the corner. The mother tried to find him, but he was missing. The mother found a police officer who told her to go to the gate and wait. Not really understanding the instructions, she did as she was told.About 45 minutes later, a Mexican man approached the border, carrying the boy. The mother ran to him, grateful that he had been found. When the man realized it was the boy's mother, he dropped him and ran. The police were waiting for him. The boy was dead, and in the 45 minutes he was missing, he had been cut open, all of his organs removed, and stuffed with bags of cocaine. The man was going to carry him across the border as if he were asleep.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 1, 2011
												The best FPS ever created.  This was my first online gaming experience and still ranks as the best.  Quality gameplay and solidity that is lacking in today's modern FPS games.  This was one of the first games to incorporate a multi-class system (besides the original Quake version of course).  There are no hats, unlockable items, powerups, killstreaks, or other gimmicks included to compensate for lack of gameplay quality.  A true gem.  I have had more fun with this game than anything I ever played.  To most people TFC would be considered a dinosaur of a game in 2011 (graphics and engine wise) many of the servers are now desolate or filled with bots.  But if you are a lover of old school shooters or want to feel some serious gaming nostalgia from the 90's I highly suggest this game, worth the $5 price it costs.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: May 21, 2014
												Ah Team Fortress Classic a good old FPS. The game is basicly like TF2 but with no hats or additonal content. the game is pretty good overall. Though the only problem I have run into is the balancing of the servers, long story short there is none which in my opinion is if your going to take a mod for Half Life 1 and make it a stand  alone game INPROVE ON IT! Now its not that I don't like this game, I do like the wide varitey of people still playing it even though the game came out in 1999. Team Fortress 2 is a superior game but TFC is were it all begun. So the only way I recommend this game is if you liked TF2 or if you want a nostagia trip. So my final verdict would be a 4/10 slightly below average.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 2, 2016
												I played it for about an hour and have NO PLANS OF STOPPING. Jesus, no wonder this game was so popular. I'm a huge TF2 fan and wanted to see what precreded it and if it was as good....well I'm happy to say my expectations were blown out of the water. As it stands, I current like this much more than TF2 for many reasons. The gameplay is like TF2 before it was bogged down with tons of unbalanced weapons and other additions that, while some were very well thought out, generally throw the gameplay into whack.In short, 10/10. I love this game. My only complain is the lack of a bots only practice mode but eh, it's hardly even an issue.

												Team Fortress Classic is a hectic fast paced battle arena, this game is a great cheap alternate to quake. Although if you do have the budget I would reccomend getting quake.Pros:-Everyone is P2P-Runs great on crappy computers-Great for couch co-opCons:-Not many players-Grenades are constantly spammed-No customizationIn conclusion, if you're looking for a fast-paced FPS game that you can enjoy with you friends I would highly reccomend Team Fortress Classic.

content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												Even though this game is quite old, it is still a legendary game loved by many FPS fans. I personally find this Team Fortress instalment one of the best, including Team Fortress 2. However, the burning question is this game worth it? Well, let's put it like this; if you are into fast-paced FPS games like Fortress Forever, sure! However, before you play this game, I would recomend trying out Fortress Forever before trying Classic out. If you like the feel of Fortress Forever, you'll like Team Fortress Classic. It's a bit more difficult to figure out at first than TF2, but you'll eventualy get used to it. Overall, this is the best FPS out there.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												Team Fortress Classic is not at all what I was expecting when I launched it for the first time. I went in assuming I was going to be playing an old school downgrade of Team Fortress 2. I was wrong, TFC is in its own rights a completely different game at first glance. The story, the graphics, and even the controls feel different, but if you play it long enough you will come to find that the game is Team Fortress at its core. The game itself has all the Team Fortress 2 "DNA" in there you just dont quite see it at first. If you play a while you will not only feel the Team Fortress-ness in the game (its the original Team Fortress so obviously) But you will get to see where the masterpiece that is Team Fortress 2 comes from, you get to see its "roots" so to speak. That in and of itself should be reason enough to play, but If I have not convinced you yet here is another reason, the best reason to play as a matter of fact. Team Fortress Classic is fun!

												Team Fortress Classic is an interesting game. It has some of the same elements as its predacessor yet it is very different at the same time. Like for example how the capture point is on the balcony of the base in 2fort instead of in the basement, and the Medic doesnt have a Medigun that can heal at a distance. Like most GoldSource Engine multiplayer games, there isnt a TON of people playing, but there is still enough people playing to get the full experience. I reccomend getting this on sale, just to try it.

												Ok, first, for those who compares to TF2 : CUT THE CRAP. Seriously dudes, of course it's not the same game at all, this one is from 99. Do you even remember how video games were in 99 ? TFC was a ♥♥♥♥ing revolution still active today with 100+ servers. It deserves respect, at least. Then, we can talk about the ♥♥♥♥ing veterans of TFC who still play today, after like 10 years, grenade spamming... The type of guy who annoys you to death because he kills you EVERY TIME calling you noob. Well, i'm this guy, and yeah, totally : you're a giant noob and it's fun to♥♥♥♥♥♥you off. We don't really need new players and it's always funny to see your Ragequit. If you have the good attitude, asking how basically grenades works and stuff, people will help you indeed, but 99,9% of time, people thought they will rek everyone ingame with their awesome skills and get frustrated. That's life, get over it. Now, I understand that TF2 originally people will not love this game, but still : don't criticize such a piece of art.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 28, 2013
												Team Fortress Classic is a fast class-based FPS. Despite some slight class balance issues the mechanics are extremely solid and the game itself is incredibly fun. It is old with clunky graphics yet has aged incredibly well with a variety of game modes and a huge amount of player created content.The biggest downside to the title is the lack of players, but due to its popularity in the past there are still a number of servers and a small yet dedicated community. This unfortunately does limit you to a fairly small selection of maps that are being actively played.If you can spare the money, I would not hesitate to give this game a try. It still has some life to it and I readily list it as one of my favourite FPS games of all time.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 21, 2014
												This game is average good, not as good as counter strike or day of defeat. But its good when you are in the mood of playing. Servers are dead, but not entirely. Maybe like 2-3 servers still up and running and has people. This game is about objectives such as sending your flag into enemy base or capture the flag. Just remember that everyone has alot of HP (like how it is with half-life basically, but can take more explosives, ALOT).Update: So after playing this a while now there are some things I'm going to say, but nonetheless I still recommend it because there were actually fun moments when playing this even though despite the servers are pretty much dead but not entirely (as said above), because there are some flaws that can and will make the game boring unless you are interested in this kind of stuff (to me, it doesnt as I just want a regular competitive match). So here are the pros and cons I've seen throughout playing this.Pros:There are moments in some servers where Team Based are really Team Based, where you work together with your team whether to get the objective in the enemy base, or grab the objective from the enemy base to your base.Mods as usual has some fun stuff, I had a blast playing them and it has its moments when that server has people and sometimes its dead. But when theres people, theres the fun. Preferably the mod maps were alot of fun.Now for cons, and those tend to happen fairly often. I wouldnt say TFC is the worst because otherwise I wouldnt be playing it and would have given a negative review otherwise.Cons:Most of the classes are useless in some servers. Mainly due to some classes overusing special grenades that gives them a super boost (such as medic and scout), depending on the servers you play, if you are playing defense you will run into them VERY often, wondering why isnt offense taking care of them. Especially when multiple people comes in.Bhopping, lets just say I have a love-hate relationship with Bhopping. Times it was fun, times it gets annoying. In this game, depending on servers once again, its annoying. Mainly on flag captures, as people say it takes "Skill". Yeah, thats true. But you know what it can also do? Scare away players, and kill the server. Making it dead (and its not the kind of where the server crashes, its the kind of where you'll end up either playing alone or 2v2, maybe less). Considering the majority of servers are already dead. Unless you love Bhopping, or just want to get into it to make the game balanced. Go for it. To me, its what makes it boring. But nonetheless I still come back and play it.I cant really say what needs to be fixed considering this is a very old game. But if you love Bhopping, you are welcome here. If you are not, just hope you get good teams or for the very least are good enough to hunt down these bhoppers. Just be aware of overused grenades and use classes that can help tip the balance for the team. There are teams like that, so if its a balanced match, you'll have a fun time.

												17 years later and I'm still playing this, so I doubt I'll ever stop. I was in the clan that had baconbowl_r's creator in it, so it's always nice to get that map randomly. Import your own sprays; lots of possiblities there. Got my mouse sensitivity turned all the way up, still has some of the best FPS movement and aiming today. More balanced than the Quakeworld mod but you can be a one-person army here unlike TF2.Much more fun to find a server with actual players. Especially on co-op maps where there's one person with a clue trying to help everyone else.

												TF2's unbelieveable younger brother, Team Fortress is just too unworthy to anyone that has been spoiled with TF2's superior graphics, enhanced differences to classes, different weapons, and, probably the biggest and best gimmick of all, free.  However, as this is the game that spawned the worlds best f2p, this game deserves some good feedback.  Since it has lower graphics, everything loads faster, and it gave me nostalgia like no other!  I recommend this for anybody who has a terrible computer, or that wants a standard old-school shooter.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 26, 2014
												Team Fortress Classic is class-based team multiplayer game, centered around 9 classes and capping flags. While it was released at first as free official mod for HL1, it's now being sold serapately on Steam. And it got a very tough rival, Team Fortress 2, that is completely free.I can say that game community is not dead yet and at certain hours you can encounter a server with some good 10-18 players game going. So, can still purchase. But there are times when servers are empty too, yes.Now, how does it compare to it's more popular TF2 brother? Well, it's much more centered on capping the flag, even Dustbowl map is centered around bringing map to the end. And the point where you cap the flag (it has team symbol on floor) is actually a different place from where flags are actually placed, mroe upfront, cutting long walks through your own base when you are bringing enemy team flag. It has mode where you have to bring Citizen class player to the end safe, but I don't see it being played nowadays at all. It's not as polished as TF2, like you can't always clearly tell color of the player when he stands in shadow. Almost all melee weapons are useless by comparison. And the game is spammy. (Almost) every class got explosive grenades (poor poor single entrance chokepoint in Dustbowl part 3)! Once you press grenade button you have around 5 seconds before it explodes, and you can just hold it for a while so you can time it to explode right when it's thrown at enemy. And I tell you, explosive grenades are powerful, making most fights last only 5 seconds, whetever it's soldier versus sniper or what not. And spammable. Get ready to be seeing those explosion sprites through which you can't see at all, while hearing more random explosion sounds somewhere else all the time.And then there are medics bunnyhopping their butts into your base, destroying every sentry and then grenade-jump out to cap the flag. And you can't stop them.Well, what I can say about gameplay in short is that is more fast-paced and rewards old-school skills (like bunny-hoping) for pro players, but it's not as balanced as TF2, neither it's as smooth. Just chaos and people bunnyhopping. As for detail classes info:Scout - The fastest class, yet the puniest. Not only his health is low, but with single-shotgun and nailgun his damage is non-existent, very unlike Scout in TF2. For grenades he got no explosives, just spikes that he can leave around self (never seen it being used good) to slow down enemies and Conc-grenade, that allows him not only to confuses enemy (their view would start to tilt around) but also allows to do grenade-jump with no harm for player. He would have been most perfect for capping flags. IF forget about Medic, who is about as mobile as Scout AND packs more health and firepower!Soldier - Strong class with supershotgun and rocket launcher, which is the best when shot at ground. Has few excplosive grenades. Good at defense and attack. Not many differences from TF2 counterpart.Pyro - A victim of being overnerfed, when compared to Quake TF. This one isn't exactly fast and got two weapons that can set enemy on fire (and normal shotgun) - flamethrower, close-range weapon, that does pathetic damage and cannon that shoots fire rockets that are much slower than Soldier ones and not as strong. Afterburn, while theorically can stack up, is not something to be proud of - it only does 8HP damage for whole duration that it lasts. Never seen anybody die from this. Got explosive grenades, one of them is fire related. Just use Soldier.Demolition Man - Defensive explosive class. Has grenade launcher that shoots nades that explodes on click (no, they don't stick), has grenade launcher with grenades that behave like your everyday nades and got shotgun. Explosive grenades - check. Mostly there to camp near flag/corridor and blow his silly nades in case of bunny. Not as allmighty as in TF2. Also got detpacks, timed HUGE explosive, which he can set up from the game menu ("shift" by default). Not much good for combat, but he got "one pony trick" - you can use it to blow some special walls in some maps.Heavy Weapons Guy - Got shotguns and minigun. Deadly, strong. Not much different from his strong brother from TF2, only this one ALSO packs explosive grenades. Good joy.Engineer - Area denial class. Nope, kidding, his sentries last only one push at most. He packs supershotgun and some laster-pistol thing that goes through bodies and he got explosive grenades. Good thing he can build sentry, dispenser and teleporters using game menu interface, which wastes metal, that every other player also carries by default. So if you are playing another class and see friendly engy - "discard ammo" from menu. No worries, it only discards ammo your class doesn't uses at all.His teleporters aren't nothing bad, though they don't seem to make a big deal in this TF. Neither does Dispenser, which while useful and give away ammo and armor (but not health!), don't make much impact and don't give you enough metal to use it effectively like in TF2. Though they make good explosive mines, when you manually destruct them... And then there is Sentry, which defends area with dual miniguns. Yet it's only good for killing rushers, it gets destroyed very quickly, as unlike TF2 you can't really tank and keep it running. Hell, it barely stops Medics assault. So rebuild, rebuild, rebuild and hope to survive, being less improtant than in TF2.Medic - Oh, sorry, it's COMBAT medic. Not the TF2-style healer, no, he is the perfect assault and flag capping class, who outdoes scout! He is fast, passing and strafecircling enemies. He isn't weak. He has supershotgun to deal huge damage and supernailgun that is ideal to quickly destroy sentry guns. He got a conc-grenade to confuse enemies and to allow self to grenade-jump, also gaining extreme speed and bunnyhopping not worse than scout. AND he got normal explosive grenade too. And has passive health regeneration.Oh, and he is medic. He got medkit which he can attempt to apply on teammates that run around, healing them. But it's not comfortable and at best used only when not busy doing his combat thing. Oh, and you can apply it to enemy, infecting them with poison. That, unlike afterburn, does more damage, never ends and can even spread. Do share. Puts Pyro to even bigger shame.Sniper - Got sniper-rilfe, automated mode of sniper rifle and nailgun. Does his usual sniping thing, though some may be uncomfortable with headshot hitbox. Spends his time moving around freely and gibbing enemy players once charged enough. In case of emergency can use auto-sniper rifle to quickly waste his ammo doing high accurate hitscan damage. Oh, and he got freaking explosive grenade. Not a puppy, as you can see.Spy - Light class that tries to outwit enemy team with usage of clunky game menu. He got supershotgun (wow!), nailgun, some pistol thing that shoots single nail that slows down target (theorically good against those medics if forget just how slow that projectile is!) and knife with which you can backstab. All of them break disguise. Also has explosive grenade and some funky area "drunkening" grenade, none of which break your disguise.And yes, like a proper spy, he got few tricks with usage of awkward in-game menu. First, he can disguise as any class on any team (by the way, friendly will see you as that class and you may end up being blown around map). Unlike TF2, you will notice that it takes really long time to disguise, but unlike TF2 it's harder to tell away disguised spy as you can't pass through friendlies either. So, worth it. Instead of having ability to cloak, spy has ability to feign death at his wish. He can be still killed and your model will turn where you are looking, but otherwise most player don't spycheck corpses either and can pass through you. Not bad. Just have to maneuver yourself though explosive-spammed envirmoments of the game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 17, 2014
												Team Fortress Classic is not at all what I was expecting when I launched it for the first time. I went in assuming I was going to be playing an old school downgrade of Team Fortress 2. I was wrong, TFC is in its own rights a completely different game at first glance. The story, the graphics, and even the controls feel different, but if you play it long enough you will come to find that the game is Team Fortress at its core. The game itself has all the Team Fortress 2 "DNA" in there you just dont quite see it at first. If you play a while you will not only feel the Team Fortress-ness in the game (its the original Team Fortress so obviously) But you will get to see where the masterpiece that is Team Fortress 2 comes from, you get to see its "roots" so to speak. That in and of itself should be reason enough to play, but If I have not convinced you yet here is another reason, the best reason to play as a matter of fact. Team Fortress Classic is fun!

												I spent countless hours playing this when I was small. It's fun, but it's not as fun as I remembered it could be. All I remember about this game is griefing my team by stealing the enemy's keycard in Rock2 (the one with the gas chamber) and bringing it back to my team's gas chamber, where the card was useless (you had to steal their card and take it to their gas chamber). Hours upon hours of "u ♥♥♥♥ing noob ur so stupid" and general expletivery ensued, usually ending when the enemy team burst into my team's gas chamber to kill me. But yeah. I think there are still people playing this game, which is more than I can say for Red Orchestra.

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												Team Fortress Classic is an interesting game. It has some of the same elements as its predacessor yet it is very different at the same time. Like for example how the capture point is on the balcony of the base in 2fort instead of in the basement, and the Medic doesnt have a Medigun that can heal at a distance. Like most GoldSource Engine multiplayer games, there isnt a TON of people playing, but there is still enough people playing to get the full experience. I reccomend getting this on sale, just to try it.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 20, 2012
												Can this be considered a mod of a mod?  I dunno.  There was team fortress for quake.  Hl1 is based off the q2 engine.  And this is the team fortress mod for hl1.  This predates tf2 by quite a few years.  Came out in the late 90's.  Back before Steam.  During WON.  You know what that is if you've played.  Great game.  Many things to master.  Fantastic maps.  VERY high replayability.  A game that never gets old.  Been going strong for 12+ years.  The community has shrunk alot.  A lot of servers have bots.  But still a few good servers with old pros and grizzled veterans.  Dustbowl still extremely popular.  Much better than tf2.  $5.  Buy it and help support a dying breed.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
												My experience with this game:Some interesting fun can be had with the right players (Oftentimes too few), there aren't enough active servers.Play styles/ skills I often see with every classScout: Just there to do objectivesPyro: Rare, but often skilled playersSoldier: reasonably skileld, usually will kick your♥♥♥♥♥if you aren't a Sniper, or solderDemoman: More dangerous than the common soldier, usually better playersEngineer: Often setting up a turrets and dispencers to keep the flag kept in friendly hands, usually helped with a soldier, medic, or demoman.Heavy Weapons Guy: Often defensive, good supportive players, makes the fight interesting.Spy: Very rare, but skilled player.... If Bunny hop is onMedic: If he isn't racing to capture the flag, he's healing/ infecting youSniper: Total try hard, Sits around all day taking pot shots at other snipers, or passing players trying to complete objectives, does not play any other class and is often with another sniper on the same team, no different compared to the TF2 snipers.Civilian: Helplessly getting killed while running from the enemy team.Notes: You can smell my salt on the sniper part.Get the game if you want something you can play for a bit at almost any location with decent internet.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: September 10, 2016
												After valve's... arguably most bugged and broken update from tf2 i took a break from it and started playing this old gem.I tried it a few times before 'meet your match' and i thought it was a fun gimmicky original that was ok at best.I was wrong.Playing this game for longer makes you realise how tf2 became what it is today and suprisingly tfc can stand on its own.While tf2 has its own in depth strategy so does tfc in a lot of ways. Medic is more combat focused an genrally more fun to play for me, soldier is as great as always, and spy is, well.... staisfying.'BUT QUARTERMASTER YOU MISSED THE BIGGEST DOWNSIDE OF THIS GAME'Yeah, the game is dead. Not being mean or anything but its ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ true as many servers are empty or full of bots. Fortunately the community that is still beating is an amazing one.Theyre less toxic since this game is the meaning of casual,so much so I could say i would rather play 2fort in tfc than tf2.Anyhow if you're a bit bored of tf2 but wanna try something incredibly similar (cos this agme first duh)Give tfc a shotTrust me its worth it.(Also i dont think ive found a single russian on a game so far so take advantage of this while you can)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 24, 2016
												17 years later and I'm still playing this, so I doubt I'll ever stop. I was in the clan that had baconbowl_r's creator in it, so it's always nice to get that map randomly. Out of practice with concjumps but decent enough to get to the opposite fort on 2forts.Graphics are totally outdated but it gives my GPU a break at max FPS. Import your own sprays; lots of possiblities there. Got my mouse sensitivity turned all the way up, still has some of the best FPS movement and aiming today. More balanced than the Quakeworld mod but you can be a one-person army here unlike TF2.Much more fun to find a server with actual players. Especially on co-op maps where there's one person with a clue trying to help everyone else.

												17 years later and I'm still playing this, so I doubt I'll ever stop. I was in the clan that had baconbowl_r's creator in it, so it's always nice to get that map randomly. Out of practice with concjumps but decent enough to get to the opposite fort on 2forts.Graphics are totally outdated but it gives my GPU a break at max FPS. Import your own sprays; lots of possiblities there. Got my mouse sensitivity turned all the way up, still has some of the best FPS movement and aiming today. More balanced than the Quakeworld mod but you can be a one-person army here unlike TF2.Much more fun to find a server with actual players. Especially on co-op maps where there's one person with a clue trying to help everyone else.

												Ah Team Fortress Classic a good old FPS. The game is basicly like TF2 but with no hats or additonal content. the game is pretty good overall. Though the only problem I have run into is the balancing of the servers, long story short there is none which in my opinion is if your going to take a mod for Half Life 1 and make it a stand  alone game INPROVE ON IT! Now its not that I don't like this game, I do like the wide varitey of people still playing it even though the game came out in 1999. Team Fortress 2 is a superior game but TFC is were it all begun. So the only way I recommend this game is if you liked TF2 or if you want a nostagia trip. So my final verdict would be a 4/10 slightly below average.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 23, 2014
												Team Fortresss Classic is a first-person shooter based on the famous QuakeWorld mod of the same name. Team Fortress Classic pits you against Red, Blue, Green and Yellow teams in different maps to capture their points or flags, capturing the final point wins the game.When this mod started out in Quake World, an online hub for playing Quake and other mods, Team Fortress Classic was taken in by VALVE who hired Robin 'Bro' Walker, Ian 'Scuba' Caughley and John 'Jojie' Cook (the guys who also do TF2!), Diaman Scott (who did the demo, i believe its on Youtube) and developed what is essentially one of the best mods of all time.Team Fortess Classic is fantastic not because it has hats. Actually this was before even hats existed, before it was even F2P. Hell, there was no custom weapons and only stock! But the fun from this game is astoudingly high, due its varied weapon system, greandes (Oh yes, lots of them).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: March 22, 2015
												I played this game since it first came out in 1999, but only started to play it via steam recently. It is one of the best team based multiplayer games, so if you are one of those players that enjoyed PC games throughout the 90s, then you have to get this game.The only cons about this game are:1. Only about 1-2 regular servers left that run the original TFC that is not moded and bugged, lagged out to hell. (1 in US, 1 in Europe, all other servers are always empty). 2. The other 2-3 servers that still are available are moded, they run like crap, make lag in-game.3. In the regular servers where the original game still plays normal, you got a few, not many, but a few people that use hacks. This will make playing certain classes very frustrating. There are really only a few, but the problem is, once they log on, they just don't leave, so you end up quitting the game yourself.If you are ok with what I wrote above, then get this game. I love this game until the 2-3 same hackers show up.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: October 31, 2015
												Even though this game is quite old, it is still a legendary game loved by many FPS fans. I personally find this Team Fortress instalment one of the best, including Team Fortress 2. However, the burning question is this game worth it? Well, let's put it like this; if you are into fast-paced FPS games like Fortress Forever, sure! However, before you play this game, I would recomend trying out Fortress Forever before trying Classic out. If you like the feel of Fortress Forever, you'll like Team Fortress Classic. It's a bit more difficult to figure out at first than TF2, but you'll eventualy get used to it. Overall, this is the best FPS out there.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 31
												Hands down the best online team-based game I have ever played and it goes so much further than just a capture the flag HL mod. The creativity that has been expressed within the TFC community over the years is vast and impressive. Some of my richest memories playing any game period comes from TFC during its peak of activity. Such a tragedy that a majority of the community just disappeared in the face of ever-increasing technology. Sad. Will always love TFC. <3
